title: (x) Dallas Morning News/New York Times/Los Angles Times heads & subheads - various {Eston, Stephen}
content:
Hi

Would really like to id the headings and sub headings of these 3 newspapers:

Dallas Morning News  
 [http://www.spacetelescope.org/about\_us/img/dallas\_morning\_news.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20110108183025/http:/www.spacetelescope.org/about_us/img/dallas_morning_news.jpg "http://www.spacetelescope.org/about\_us/img/dallas\_morning\_news.jpg")

New York Times  
 [http://www.newsdesigner.com/blog/tfp/nytdaily.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20110108183025/http:/www.newsdesigner.com/blog/tfp/nytdaily.php "http://www.newsdesigner.com/blog/tfp/nytdaily.php")

Los Angles Times  
 [http://www.newsdesigner.com/blog/tfp/ladaily.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20110108183025/http:/www.newsdesigner.com/blog/tfp/ladaily.php "http://www.newsdesigner.com/blog/tfp/ladaily.php")

Would be great to get any of them...

Thanks!
author: Marstrois

comments.content: The NYT's headlines and subheads are based on the Cheltenham family. (ITC Cheltenham Bold Condensed, ITC Cheltenham Condensed, ITC Cheltenham Regular, ITC Cheltenham Bold)

NYT uses a [custom Cheltenham](http://web.archive.org/web/20110108183025/http:/www.newsdesigner.com/archives/2003_10.php) drawn by Matthew Carter. Here are other versions of [Cheltenham](http://web.archive.org/web/20110108183025/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=cheltenham).
eston and I in unison! Actually, they are closer to the Cheltenhams by E+F, Bitstream, and URW. ITC Cheltenham has that monstrous x-height.
See look, I learned something new. I thought they used the ITC variants.
Here's the [Typographica post](http://web.archive.org/web/20110108183025/http:/typographi.com/000723.php) on the Times type.

Seems Matthew Carter designed the font (Miller) used in the Dallas Morning News too.

[http://fontbureau.com/news/2002-11-10](http://web.archive.org/web/20110108183025/http:/fontbureau.com/news/2002-11-10 "http://fontbureau.com/news/2002-11-10")

Here's the showing: [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Miller](http://web.archive.org/web/20110108183025/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Miller "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Miller")

Here's an article on the type in the LA Times

[http://www.fontbureau.com/news/2002-10-14](http://web.archive.org/web/20110108183025/http:/www.fontbureau.com/news/2002-10-14 "http://www.fontbureau.com/news/2002-10-14")
